farmer.title: Rain
farmer.text: A farmer kneels before the altar, his hands rough with work. He asks for rain to soften the soil and feed his crops.

farmer.title: Good Harvest
farmer.text: A farmer sets a small bundle of wheat before the shrine. He prays for the coming season to be kind and the grain to grow tall.

farmer.title: Healthy Livestock
farmer.text: A shepherd bows low. He says the goats have grown sick and asks the gods to spare what remains of his herd.

merchant.title: Calm Seas
merchant.text: A merchant offers a small clay vessel of oil. He asks for steady winds and calm waters so his ships may sail safely.

merchant.title: Safe Roads
merchant.text: A trader adjusts his cloak nervously. He says bandits stalk the roads and prays for protection on his next journey.

merchant.title: Healthy Workers
merchant.text: A shopkeeper bows and prays that his apprentices stay strong through the long summer heat.

nobleman.title: Heir’s Health
nobleman.text: A nobleman stands tall but speaks softly. His son is sick, and he prays for his recovery before the family line is broken.

nobleman.title: Estate Prosperity
nobleman.text: A noblewoman offers fine wine. She prays that her estate’s fields bear fruit and her servants stay loyal.

nobleman.title: Long Life
nobleman.text: An aging patrician lights incense. He asks the gods for more years to guide his household and see his grandchildren grown.

foreigner.title: Acceptance
foreigner.text: A traveler bows deeply. He prays that the local gods welcome him, though he is far from home and speaks their names poorly.

foreigner.title: Fertile Land
foreigner.text: A settler from distant shores offers foreign grain. He asks the gods to let it take root in this new soil.

foreigner.title: Safe Lodging
foreigner.text: A foreign craftsman prays for a place to rest and that no sickness find him in a strange land.

beggar.title: Daily Bread
beggar.text: A thin man kneels quietly. He asks only that he not go hungry another night.

beggar.title: Shelter
beggar.text: A woman with tattered clothes whispers a prayer for a roof to sleep under before the next storm.

beggar.title: Kind Weather
beggar.text: An old beggar lifts his face to the sky. He prays that the coming winter be mild on those without homes.

priest.title: Purification
priest.text: A young priest brings a cracked jug of holy water. He prays for strength to cleanse the temple before the next festival.

priest.title: Sacred Spring
priest.text: An oracle says the sacred well runs low. She prays the gods renew it so the rites may continue.

priest.title: Temple’s Blessing
priest.text: An old priest bows. He asks for favor on the temple and those who serve within its walls.

soldier.title: Healing
soldier.text: A soldier stands with his arm in a sling. He asks the gods to heal his wounds so he may return to duty.

soldier.title: Strength
soldier.text: A hoplite with bandaged legs prays quietly for renewed strength and clear sight for the next march.

soldier.title: Safe Return
soldier.text: A young guard bows and asks to come home alive once his watch along the border ends.

artist.title: Inspiration
artist.text: A playwright speaks humbly. He says his thoughts have grown dull and asks for the Muses to stir his mind again.

artist.title: Clear Voice
artist.text: A singer offers a honey cake. She prays her voice holds true for the coming festival performance.

artist.title: Good Audience
artist.text: An actor bows before the statue. He asks that the crowd listen kindly and the play end with applause.

farmer.title: Fair Trade
farmer.text: A farmer brings olives and prays that the merchants in town pay an honest price this season.

farmer.title: New Tools
farmer.text: A farmer with cracked hands asks for the means to replace his broken plow.

farmer.title: Market Luck
farmer.text: A farmer smiles shyly. He prays that his produce finds buyers before it spoils.

merchant.title: Prosperity
merchant.text: A merchant sets down a pouch of coins. He asks that his business thrive and his partners deal fairly.

merchant.title: Trade Route Safety
merchant.text: A trader prays for safe passage for his caravans through rough mountain roads.

merchant.title: Honest Partners
merchant.text: A spice dealer prays that his partners remain true and his name stay clean in the marketplace.

nobleman.title: Favor at Court
nobleman.text: A nobleman prays to speak wisely at the council and win the ears of those in power.

nobleman.title: Art Patronage
nobleman.text: A noblewoman leaves silver coins. She asks that her commissioned sculptor finish his work with divine inspiration.

nobleman.title: Estate Wealth
nobleman.text: A patrician prays that his lands yield enough to host grand feasts and uphold his family’s name.

foreigner.title: Fair Dealings
foreigner.text: A trader from distant lands prays that locals treat him fairly in business despite his accent.

foreigner.title: Cultural Exchange
foreigner.text: A scholar from afar prays that his teachings be accepted and understood in this city.

foreigner.title: Good Reputation
foreigner.text: A foreign merchant asks the gods that no lies be spoken about his goods or craft.

beggar.title: Work
beggar.text: A poor man prays for someone to offer him honest labor, even if only for a day.

beggar.title: Tools
beggar.text: A destitute potter asks for simple tools so he can work again and not beg.

beggar.title: Learning
beggar.text: A young beggar prays to be taken as an apprentice in any craft that will keep him fed.

priest.title: Festival Order
priest.text: A temple priest prays that the upcoming festival go smoothly and all offerings be accepted.

priest.title: Donations
priest.text: A priest asks the gods to move the hearts of citizens to give generously to the temple fund.

priest.title: Craftsmen’s Blessing
priest.text: An oracle prays that local artisans find skill and harmony in their work for the temple.

soldier.title: Smith’s Fire
soldier.text: A soldier brings a dull sword. He prays the city’s smiths work well so blades hold strong.

soldier.title: Sturdy Armor
soldier.text: A hoplite kneels, praying for armor that will not fail in battle.

soldier.title: Fair Pay
soldier.text: A soldier bows and prays that his wages be paid in full when the campaign ends.

artist.title: Inspiration
artist.text: An artist prays that new ideas come to him before the next festival.

artist.title: Generous Patrons
artist.text: A poet prays that wealthy citizens notice his talent and commission his work.

artist.title: Skilled Hands
artist.text: A painter bows and asks for steady hands to complete his mural before the deadline.

farmer.title: Peaceful Borders
farmer.text: A farmer near the frontier prays that the soldiers keep the enemy far from his fields.

farmer.title: Untouched Harvest
farmer.text: A man holding a sickle prays that no army trample his crops this season.

farmer.title: Safety of Family
farmer.text: A farmer asks the gods to protect his wife and children if war comes too near.

merchant.title: Safe Convoy
merchant.text: A merchant bows. He asks the gods to guard his wagons as they pass through war-torn roads.

merchant.title: Loyal Guards
merchant.text: A trader prays his hired guards stand firm if ambushed on the trade route.

merchant.title: Market Stability
merchant.text: A merchant prays that war not ruin the markets or drive away his customers.

nobleman.title: Victory
nobleman.text: A noble general prays that his army prevail and his family’s name be honored in victory.

nobleman.title: Courage of Men
nobleman.text: A commander offers a bronze helm. He asks for bravery among his soldiers when the fighting begins.

nobleman.title: Strategic Wisdom
nobleman.text: A noble prays for a clear mind to outthink his enemies and save his city.

foreigner.title: Redemption
foreigner.text: A foreign warrior prays for a chance to prove his loyalty after fleeing a lost homeland.

foreigner.title: Peace Treaty
foreigner.text: A diplomat from another city prays that talks go well and bloodshed can be avoided.

foreigner.title: Survival
foreigner.text: A mercenary from afar prays that he live to see another dawn, no matter who wins.

beggar.title: For the Fallen
beggar.text: A beggar lays wilted flowers on the steps. He prays that his brother’s spirit find rest.

beggar.title: End of War
beggar.text: A poor widow prays that no more sons be taken for fighting.

beggar.title: Protection
beggar.text: A beggar from a ruined village asks that the city walls hold strong.

priest.title: War Omens
priest.text: An oracle’s voice shakes. She asks the gods to reveal whether the coming war will favor their city.

priest.title: Blessing of Arms
priest.text: A priest prays over offerings of iron. He asks the gods to bless every spear and shield.

priest.title: Peaceful End
priest.text: A temple elder prays that when war ends, mercy follows quickly.

soldier.title: Courage
soldier.text: A young soldier prays for the strength not to flee when the horns sound.

soldier.title: Victory
soldier.text: A hoplite kneels and asks the gods to let him strike true and stand unharmed.

soldier.title: Return Home
soldier.text: A weary veteran prays only to see his family again once the campaign ends.

artist.title: Epic Ending
artist.text: A playwright prays for words to finish his tragedy about the war just fought.

artist.title: War Memorial
artist.text: A sculptor prays that his monument to the fallen stands tall for generations.

artist.title: Battle Hymn
artist.text: A musician asks for strength to compose a song that honors both bravery and loss.

farmer.title: Love’s Return
farmer.text: A farmer prays his wife, gone to her family, will forgive his anger and return home.

farmer.title: Peace for Ancestors
farmer.text: A man lights a small fire. He prays that his father’s spirit rest easily beneath the earth.

farmer.title: Hope
farmer.text: A farmer bows and asks the gods not to forget the humble, even when the fields are bare.

merchant.title: Reconciliation
merchant.text: A merchant prays for peace with his brother after years of bitter dispute over inheritance.

merchant.title: Good Marriage
merchant.text: A trader prays that his daughter’s wedding bring happiness and not misfortune.

merchant.title: Safe Passage of Soul
merchant.text: A wealthy man prays for his mother’s soul to find her way to the afterlife.

nobleman.title: Eternal Name
nobleman.text: A nobleman prays that his deeds be remembered long after death.

nobleman.title: Faithful Love
nobleman.text: A widow of noble birth prays that her husband’s spirit watches over her kindly.

nobleman.title: Ancestral Favor
nobleman.text: A noble family offers wine. They pray their ancestors bless their descendants with unity.

foreigner.title: Unknown Gods
foreigner.text: A traveler prays to any who will listen. He hopes the local gods accept his offering.

foreigner.title: Memory of Home
foreigner.text: A foreigner lights incense for those buried far away, asking that distance not divide their souls.

foreigner.title: Shared Faith
foreigner.text: A traveler prays that the people here understand that all gods hear the same hearts.

beggar.title: Mercy
beggar.text: A beggar kneels and whispers, asking the gods for kindness in life or death.

beggar.title: Rest for the Lost
beggar.text: A blind beggar prays for those who died forgotten to be remembered once more.

beggar.title: Small Joys
beggar.text: A poor woman prays for someone to smile at her in the street, just once more.

priest.title: Guidance
priest.text: An oracle prays that her visions show truth and not the tricks of restless spirits.

priest.title: Rite of Passage
priest.text: A priest prays that the souls of the newly dead reach the afterlife without delay.

priest.title: Divine Favor
priest.text: A temple elder prays for a sign that the gods still walk among their people.

soldier.title: Fallen Comrade
soldier.text: A soldier lays his helmet down. He prays that his friend’s soul find peace in the afterlife.

soldier.title: Redemption
soldier.text: A mercenary prays for forgiveness for the lives he has taken.

soldier.title: Homecoming
soldier.text: A soldier prays that when his time comes, his body is returned to his family for proper burial.

artist.title: Beloved Muse
artist.text: A sculptor prays before a statue of his late wife, asking for her guidance in his art.

artist.title: True Love
artist.text: A young poet prays that his affection be returned and not mocked.

artist.title: Beauty Remembered
artist.text: An old painter prays that the gods let his work preserve the faces of those he loved.
